newsitem.title: USA: Oracle unveils software transfer for NCs.
newsitem.headline: Oracle unveils software transfer for NCs.

text.p: Oracle Corp, aiming to boost the marketability of its network computer technology, announced a software tool that will let companies put programs they have in use on in-house computer networks onto the Internet or intranets without rewriting programming code.
The new tool, called Developer/2000 for the Web, would mean companies can start using NCs without having to spend a lot of time writing new applications for these machines.
But it works only on applications written for Oracle databases.
NCs, stripped-down computers that are less expensive than office PC's or workstations, get their software from the Internet or corporate intranets.
